flask_scheema.specification package¶

Submodules¶

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation module¶

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.append_parameters(spec_template: dict, path_params: list, http_method: str, input_schema: Schema, output_schema: Schema, model: DeclarativeBase)[source]¶

Appends parameters to the spec template based on the input.

Parameters:

  • spec_template (dict) – Spec template to append parameters to.

  • path_params (list) – Path parameters to append.

  • http_method (str) – HTTP method to append parameters for.

  • input_schema (Schema) – Input schema to append.

  • output_schema (Schema) – Output schema to append.

  • model – Database model to append.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.convert_path_to_openapi(path: str) → str[source]¶

Converts a flask path to an openapi path.

Parameters:

path – Flask path to convert.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.generate_fields_description(schema: AutoScheema) → str[source]¶

Generates fields description from a schema for the API docs.

Parameters:

schema – Schema to generate fields description from.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.generate_filter_examples(schema: Callable) → str[source]¶

Generates filter examples from a model, e.g.: Filters to apply on the data. E.g. id=1, name=John, age>20. Supported operators: =, >, <, like, in.#

Parameters:

schema – Schema to generate filter examples from.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.generate_path_params_from_rule(rule) → List[dict][source]¶

Generates path parameters from a rule.

Parameters:

rule – Rule to generate path parameters from.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.generate_swagger_spec(http_method: str, f: Callable, input_schema: Schema = None, output_schema: Schema = None, model: DeclarativeBase = None, path_params: list = None) → dict[source]¶
flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.generate_x_description(template_data: Dict, path: str = '') → str[source]¶

Generates filter examples from a model, e.g.: Filters to apply on the data. E.g. id=1, name=John, age>20. Supported operators: =, >, <, like, in.#

Parameters:

  • template_data (dict) – Template data to generate filter examples from.

  • path – Path to the template.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.get_template_data_for_model(schema) → dict | None[source]¶

Generates model data for jinja template and redoc.

Parameters:

schema – Schema to generate model data for.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.handle_authorization(f, spec_template)[source]¶
flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.initialize_spec_template()[source]¶

Initializes the spec template. :returns: Spec template. :rtype: dict

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.make_endpoint_description(schema: Schema, http_method: str, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generates endpoint description from a schema for the API docs.

Only applicable in FULL_AUTO mode or if AUTO_NAME_ENDPOINTS = True

Parameters:

  • schema (Callable) – Schema to generate endpoint description from.

  • http_method – HTTP method.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.make_endpoint_params_description(schema: Schema, data: dict)[source]¶

Generates endpoint parameters description from a schema for the API docs.

Parameters:

  • schema (Schema) – Schema to generate endpoint parameters description from.

  • data – Data to generate endpoint parameters description from.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.register_routes_with_spec(naan: Naan, route_spec: List)[source]¶

Registers all flask_scheemaa with the apispec object. Which flask_scheemaa should be registered is determined by the decorators and builds the openapi spec, which is served with Redoc.

Parameters:

  • naan (Naan) – The naan object.

  • route_spec – List of routes/schemas to register with the apispec.

flask_scheema.specification.doc_generation.register_schemas(spec: APISpec, input_schema: Schema, output_schema: Schema | None = None, force_update=False)[source]¶

Registers schemas with the apispec object.

Parameters:

  • spec (APISpec) – APISpec object to register schemas with.

  • input_schema (Schema) – Input schema to register.

  • output_schema (Schema) – Output schema to register.

  • force_update (bool) – If True, will update the schema even if it already exists.

flask_scheema.specification.specification module¶

class flask_scheema.specification.specification.CurrySpec(app: Flask, naan: Naan, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: APISpec, AttributeInitializerMixin

This is a subclass of APISpec that allows for the specification of the tag groups.

api_description: str | None = None¶
api_keywords: list | None = []¶
api_logo_background: str | None = None¶
api_logo_url: str | None = None¶
api_title: str | None = ''¶
api_version: str | None = ''¶
app: Flask¶
create_api_docs: bool | None = True¶
create_specification_blueprint(url_prefix=None)[source]¶

Sets up the blueprint for the api specification and to serve the redoc docs.

Parameters:

url_prefix – The url prefix for the blueprint.

documentation_url: str | None = '/docs'¶
documentation_url_prefix: str | None = '/'¶
make_api_spec_data() → dict[source]¶

Creates the data for the api spec object.

Returns:

The data for the api spec object.

Return type:

dict

naan: Naan¶
set_xtags_group(tag_name: str, group_name: str)[source]¶

Adds endpoint tag to a tag-group, creating the group if it doesn’t exist.

This is used to group endpoint tags in the docs.

Parameters:

  • tag_name (str) – Name of the tag to add, this should have already been registered.

  • group_name – Name of the group to add the tag to.

spec_groups: dict = {'x-tagGroups': []}¶
to_dict() → dict[source]¶

Returns the api spec object as a dictionary. :returns: The api spec object as a dictionary. :rtype: dict

flask_scheema.specification.utilities module¶

flask_scheema.specification.utilities.generate_readme_html(folder: str)[source]¶

Generate a readme.MD file in the parent directory of the html’ folder.

Parameters:

folder (str) – The name of the folder to search for.

Returns:

The path to the readme.MD file.

flask_scheema.specification.utilities.read_readme_content_to_string(path: str)[source]¶

Get the content of the readme.MD file, starting at the calling functions directory and moving up the directory tree until the file is found.

Parameters:

path – The path to the readme.MD file.

Returns:

The content of the readme.MD file.
